question: Figure 1 shows a large wind farm off the coast of the UK. The mean power output of the wind farm is 696 MW, which is enough power for 580,000 homes.

parts.question: Calculate the mean power needed for 1 home. Give your answer in watts.

answers: The total power output of the wind farm is 696,000,000 W.

parts.question: On one day the demand for electricity in the UK was 34 000 MW. Suggest two reasons why wind power was not able to meet this demand.

answers: wind turbines don’t turn when the wind is too strong/weak
there are not enough wind turbines (in the UK)
alternatives: it was not windy (on that day)
some wind turbines may be offline for maintenance
energy from wind may not be enough (to generate 34 000 MW)

parts.question: Some of the energy from the wind used to rotate a wind turbine is wasted. An engineer oils the mechanical parts of a wind turbine. Explain how oiling would affect the efficiency of the wind turbine.

answers: because the percentage / proportion / amount of energy usefully transferred would increase OR because the percentage / proportion / amount of energy wasted would decrease
